apiOperation.shortdesc: Disables usage of the network by this Firestore instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disables usage of the network by this Firestore instance. It can be re-enabled by via enableNetwork. While the network is disabled, any snapshot listeners or get calls will return results from cache and any write operations will be queued until the network is restored.

apiValue.shortdesc: The FCM token is used to identify this device so that FCM can send notifications to it.

apiDesc.p: The FCM token is used to identify this device so that FCM can send notifications to it. It is associated with your APNS token when the APNS token is supplied, so that sending messages to the FCM token will be delivered over APNS.
The FCM token is sometimes refreshed automatically.
Once you have an FCM token, you should send it to your application server, so it can use the FCM token to send notifications to your device.

apiValue.shortdesc: The id of the channel.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The id of the channel. Must be unique per package. The value may be truncated if it is too long.

apiValue.shortdesc: The user visible name of the channel.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The user visible name of the channel. The recommended maximum length is 40 characters; the value may be truncated if it is too long.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disposes the ANE

apiValue.shortdesc: Controls the capture of performance data.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Controls the capture of performance data. When this value is set to NO, none of the performance data will sent to the server. Default is true.
This setting is persisted, and is applied on future invocations of your application. Once explicitly set, it overrides any settings in your Info.plist.

apiValue.shortdesc: Controls the instrumentation of the app to capture performance data.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Controls the instrumentation of the app to capture performance data. When this value is set to NO, the app will not be instrumented to collect performance data (in scenarios like app_start, networking monitoring). Default is true.
This setting is persisted, and is applied on future invocations of your application. Once explicitly set, it overrides any settings in your Info.plist.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Applies Fetched Config data to the Active Config, causing updates to the behavior and appearance of the app to take effect (depending on how config data is used in the app).

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if there was a Fetched Config, and it was activated, false if no Fetched Config was found, or the Fetched Config was already activated.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Applies Fetched Config data to the Active Config, causing updates to the behavior and appearance of the app to take effect (depending on how config data is used in the app).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Asynchronously activates the most recently fetched configs, so that the fetched key value pairs take effect.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Asynchronously activates the most recently fetched configs, so that the fetched key value pairs take effect.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperation.shortdesc: Asynchronously fetches and then activates the fetched configs.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Asynchronously fetches and then activates the fetched configs. If the time elapsed since the last fetch from the Firebase Remote Config backend is more than the default minimum fetch interval, configs are fetched from the backend. After the fetch is complete, the configs are activated so that the fetched key value pairs take effect.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Fetches Remote Config data and sets a duration that specifies how long config data lasts.

apiParam.apiDesc: Duration that defines how long fetched config data is available, in seconds. When the config data expires, a new fetch is required.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Fetches Remote Config data and sets a duration that specifies how long config data lasts. Call activateFetched to make fetched data available to your app.

apiValue.shortdesc: This Boolean enables or disables debug logging, such as kit version information.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: This Boolean enables or disables debug logging, such as kit version information. The default value is false.

apiValue.shortdesc: Specify a user email which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Specify a user email which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI. Please be mindful of your end-user's privacy and see if setUserIdentifier: can fulfil your needs.

apiValue.shortdesc: Specify a user identifier which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Specify a user identifier which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI.
Many of our customers have requested the ability to tie crashes to specific end-users of their application in order to facilitate responses to support requests or permit the ability to reach out for more information. We allow you to specify up to three separate values for display within the Crashlytics UI - but please be mindful of your end-user's privacy.
We recommend specifying a user identifier - an arbitrary string that ties an end-user to a record in your system. This could be a database id, hash, or other value that is meaningless to a third-party observer but can be indexed and queried by you.
Optionally, you may also specify the end-user's name or username, as well as email address if you do not have a system that works well with obscured identifiers.
Pursuant to our EULA, this data is transferred securely throughout our system and we will not disseminate end-user data unless required to by law. That said, if you choose to provide end-user contact information, we strongly recommend that you disclose this in your application's privacy policy. Data privacy is of our utmost concern.

apiValue.shortdesc: Specify a user name which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Specify a user name which will be visible in the Crashlytics UI. Please be mindful of your end-user's privacy and see if setUserIdentifier: can fulfil your needs.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disposes the ANE

apiDesc.p: The name of the event. Should contain 1 to 40 alphanumeric characters or underscores. The name must start with an alphabetic character. Some event names are reserved.

The Object of event parameters. Passing null indicates that the event has no parameters. Parameter names can be up to 40 characters long and must start with an alphabetic character and contain only alphanumeric characters and underscores. Only String and Number parameter types are supported.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Clears all analytics data for this app from the device and resets the app instance id.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Clears all analytics data for this app from the device and resets the app instance id. Android only.

apiDesc.p: The name of the user property to set. Should contain 1 to 24 alphanumeric characters or underscores and must start with an alphabetic character. The "firebase_", "google_", and "ga_" prefixes are reserved and should not be used for user property names.
The value of the user property. Values can be up to 36 characters long. Setting the value to null removes the user property.

apiValue.shortdesc: The unique ID for this instance of the application.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The unique ID for this instance of the application.

apiValue.shortdesc: Sets whether analytics collection is enabled for this app on this device.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Sets whether analytics collection is enabled for this app on this device. This setting is persisted across app sessions. By default it is enabled.

apiValue.shortdesc: The name of the current screen.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The name of the current screen. Should contain 1 to 100 characters. Set to null to clear the current screen name.

apiValue.shortdesc: Sets the minimum engagement time in seconds required to start a new session.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Sets the minimum engagement time in seconds required to start a new session. The default value is 10000 milliseconds.

apiValue.shortdesc: Sets the interval of inactivity in seconds that terminates the current session.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Sets the interval of inactivity in seconds that terminates the current session. The default value is 1800000 milliseconds (30 minutes).

apiValue.shortdesc: The user ID to ascribe to the user of this app on this device, which must be non-empty and no more than 256 characters long.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The user ID to ascribe to the user of this app on this device, which must be non-empty and no more than 256 characters long. Setting userID to null removes the user ID.
